page.title: 07APLEY PARK ESTATE,STOCKTON
page.content: THE ESTATE COVERS 35OO HA.,MOST OF IT PRIME AGRICULTURAL LAND FARMED BY 13 TENANT FARMSTEADS AND IS OWNED BY JAMES HAMILTON.MOST OF THE ESTATE IS COVERED BY PASTURE AND CROPLAND,WHILST THE STEEP SLOPES ARE WOODED FOR COMMERCIAL USE (PIT PROPS,CONSTRUCTION TIMBER) OR TO PROVIDE COVER FOR PHEASANTS.THE ESTATE EXTENDS SOUTH TO THE TOWN OF BRIDGNORTH AND ALOT OF THE BUILDINS HERE LIE ON APLEY LAND.THE ESTATE AND NORTON BELONG TO THE "CLOSED ESTATE" TYPE OF SETTLEMENT WITH ALONG ESTABLISHED RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITY AND FEW NEWCOMERS. THE MAJORITY OF DWELLINGS ARE ESTATE OWNED AND MOST RESIDENTS WORK OR WORKED ON THE ESTATE. APLEY IS A BENEVOLENT ESTABLISHEMNT TAKING CARE OF ITS RESIDENTS PARTICULARLY THE RETIRED.THE VILLAGE PUB IS OWNED BY THE ESTATE AND IN 19O8 A READING ROOM WAS PROVIDED.
